activities.loc: Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level Hearing Room - LC300

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cameron Monette

11:41 AM Defendant Cameron Monette in court, in custody.  Attorney Addison R Kuhn in court for Cameron Monette.  Attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Continued final pretrial.
Parties are in trial posture.
No statements were made by defendant.
State has no objection to defense MIL.

9:19 AM Defendant Cameron Monette in court, in custody.  Attorney James J. Ermert in court for Cameron Monette.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defense moving to withdraw.  Defense to file a motion.
BTC: Finding of good cause to waive time limits.

10:49 AM Defendant Cameron Monette in court, in custody.  Attorney James J. Ermert not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Defendant states he talked to attorney yesterday.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Atty. James Ermert.

1:14 PM Defendant Cameron Monette in court, in custody.  Attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Matter here for motion to dismiss and motion for defendant to represent himself.
Defendant states he would like to represent himself.
Cameron Monette, DSAT.
Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding representing himself.
Defendant states that Atty. Ermert is appointed on his revocation case.
Court asks defendant if he would like Atty. Ermert appointed on this case as well.
Defendant is worried about communication with counsel.
Defendant agrees to have Atty. Ermert represent him in this case.
BTC: Atty. James Ermert appointed as counsel in this case.  Finding of good cause to waive time limits.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Cameron Monette appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Cameron Monette. Court Reporter: Lori Thornton. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on June 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
